item.title: Trump urges Israel's president to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu
item.description: President Herzog's office says he holds Trump "in the highest regard", but that anyone seeking a pardon has to submit a formal request.

item.title: Delhi blast was terror incident, Indian government says
item.description: India's government says it unequivocally condemns the "dastardly and cowardly act" that killed eight people.

item.title: French relief as Algeria frees jailed novelist at centre of diplomatic crisis
item.description: Almost a year to the day after Boualem Sansal was arrested, the Algerian president grants him a pardon.

item.title: Italy investigates claim that tourists paid to go to Bosnia to kill besieged civilians
item.description: Italians and others are alleged to have paid large sums to fire at Bosnians risking their lives in besieged Sarajevo.

item.title: At least 37 killed in Peru after bus plunges into ravine
item.description: The bus was carrying 60 passengers when it collided with a truck and careered off the road in the Arequipa region.
